Sentencas: The alleviation of SiO2 as contaminant in SOFC electrolyte was studied through spark plasma sintering (SPS) of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) doped with similar to0.5 wt.% SiO2.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: The outcome of variations in SPS process conditions such as sintering temperature, duration, and applied pressure on the grain boundary and grain interior resistivity of silica-doped YSZ electrolyte was studied with ac impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: Results show that the apparent grain boundary resistivity of SPS-processed silica-containing YSZ electrolyte is moderately higher than that of pure YSZ electrolyte, but it was significantly lower than that of silica-containing YSZ electrolyte prepared by conventional sintering.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: A linear correlation was observed between relative density and grain interior resistivity, no matter what sintering method or starting powder was adopted.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: Furthermore, the apparent grain boundary resistivity was found to be strongly dependent on the grain size and the effective conducting area of the grain boundary.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: Results showed that SPS was an efficacious powder consolidation method, and it could effectively shorten the sintering duration down to several minutes.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: It was also found to significantly reduce the grain boundary resistivity without detrimental consequence on the grain interior resistivity.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)

Sentencas: This raised the prospect of scavenging the detrimental effects of contaminants in SOFC electrolyte through SPS processing.
Titulo: Overcoming the effect of contaminant in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrolyte: spark plasma sintering (SPS) of 0.5 wt.% silica-doped yttria- stabilized zirconia (YSZ)
